abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Administration Reform Project
            will support the Administrative Reform Program adopted by
            the Government of Jamaica as part of its overall structural
            adjustment program supported by the Bank's second SAL.
            The objective of the Jamaican program is to create an
            improved administrative environment in the Government to
            support more effective and efficient performance on the part
            of Jamaican line ministries, particularly those critical to
            the structural adjustment process and economic development
            in general. The project finances consultants, training and
            equipment for three major objectives: (i) to equip the
            Government's human resource management agencies with
            the capacity to rationalize and manage the Government's
            compensation strategy and organizational structure, and to
            assist in the decentralization of key personnel
            responsibilities to line ministries; (ii) to improve the
            Government's financial capability by installing a
            performance budgeting system, strengthening accounting and
            auditing functions; developing a financial officer corps,
            providing training in accounting and finance, and
            strengthening of the Ministry of Finance; and (iii) to
            restructure a selected line ministry according to a program
            management concept.
